title: The Thermostat War
setting: DataPulse Analytics, open office, Monday morning
premise: Someone changed the office thermostat password and set it to 58 degrees over the weekend. The entire office is freezing and nobody can change it back.

suspects.name: Rita Sharma
suspects.motive: Always complains the office is too hot and brings a personal fan
suspects.alibi: I was visiting my parents in Boston all weekend. My flight landed Sunday at 9 PM and I came straight to the office Monday at 8 AM. I can show my boarding pass.

suspects.name: Liam O'Donnell
suspects.motive: Wants server room temperatures lowered and has complained about office heat affecting nearby equipment
suspects.alibi: I worked from home all weekend on a deployment. My Git commits are timestamped Saturday and Sunday from my home IP. I didn't leave the house.

suspects.name: Yuki Tanaka
suspects.motive: Recently lost the 'thermostat committee' vote and was vocal about it
suspects.alibi: I came in Sunday afternoon around 2 PM to prep for Monday's sprint planning. I was in the conference room on the third floor for about two hours.

suspects.name: Ben Cooper
suspects.motive: Has been pushing management to upgrade to a smart thermostat system
suspects.alibi: I was off all weekend for my anniversary trip. My wife and I stayed at a bed and breakfast upstate. We didn't get back until Monday morning.

clues.title: Thermostat Access Log
clues.content: The smart thermostat's app log shows the password was changed and temperature set to 58 degrees at 3:15 PM Sunday from the office Wi-Fi network.

clues.title: Building Security Log
clues.content: Sunday's building entry log shows only one person entered the building: Yuki Tanaka at 1:52 PM. No other entries were recorded until Monday morning.

clues.title: Conference Room Details
clues.content: Yuki says she was in the third-floor conference room for two hours. But the thermostat panel is on the second floor, and the building elevator log shows a trip from floor three to floor two at 3:10 PM Sunday.

hints.text: The thermostat was changed on Sunday afternoon. Who was actually in the building at that time?
If someone claims they stayed on one floor the entire time, is there any evidence they visited another floor?
